CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection allowed (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies)
TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant introduced proceedings in ORG ( Bezirksgericht ) against a former lawyer for the sum of CARDINAL NORP schillings ( ORG ) . ORG rejected the claim on DATE because it considered that it had no jurisdiction . On DATE it quashed its previous decision and , upon the applicant 's request ( GPE ) , remitted the case to ORG ( PERSON ) . On DATE ORG instructed the applicant to submit his claim through a lawyer , which he did on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that the judge who had been in charge of the case was not impartial , and quashed all procedural steps taken after DATE .

CARDINAL . A defence pleading was lodged on DATE and , on CARDINAL DATE , at the applicant 's request , ORG adjourned the proceedings pending the outcome of a different action , the proceedings only to be resumed on application by the parties . On DATE the applicant 's lawyer requested that the proceedings be resumed and increased the claim to ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL . ORG returned the request on CARDINAL August DATE with the instruction to formulate it properly .
CARDINAL . A hearing which had been set down for DATE was adjourned when the judge in charge of the case changed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the defendant gave up his professional activities , and the proceedings had to be adjourned for a lawyer to be appointed . On DATE the applicant requested the court to order the defendant to appoint a lawyer , and on DATE it did so . The defendant failed to appoint a lawyer within the time - limit . On DATE the court announced that , in view of the defendant 's failure to appoint a lawyer , the proceedings were resumed . A hearing was fixed for DATE .

CARDINAL . At the hearing on DATE the proceedings had to be commenced again because of a change of judge . The defendant was neither present nor represented , and the applicant 's representative asked for judgment to be entered by default . The court adjourned the proceedings in order to allow consideration to be given to additional papers submitted by the applicant 's representatives . On DATE ORG permitted the defendant , who had produced a medical certificate in respect of DATE , to remain in the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant wrote to the court requesting that the proceedings be resumed . On DATE the parties were summoned to a hearing set for CARDINAL DATE . That hearing was postponed as the applicant had informed the court that he would be absent from DATE to CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the applicant again asked for the proceedings to be resumed . On DATE the parties were summoned to a hearing set for DATE . At the end of that hearing the proceedings were adjourned , and on CARDINAL DATE the applicant asked for them to be resumed soon as he was to be away from DATE to DATE . On CARDINAL DATE the court set the next hearing for DATE , when the applicant replied to questions , his representative submitted a series of documents and the proceedings were again adjourned .

CARDINAL . The next hearing took place on CARDINAL DATE , at the end of which the judge declared the trial closed . The judgment , DATE , was received by the applicant 's representative on DATE . The court found that the applicant 's action was statute - barred . The applicant 's appeal of CARDINAL DATE was returned by the court on DATE as it had not been duly signed by a lawyer . The appeal was re - submitted on DATE . The defendant 's reply was dated DATE , and by a judgment dated DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal , confirming ORG judgment . The judgment stated that no further appeal ( Revision ) was possible . The applicant 's representative received the decision on DATE .
CARDINAL . An application by the applicant for legal aid for an extraordinary appeal dated DATE was rejected on DATE as the proceedings had ended .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed a challenge by the applicant to a decision of ORG of DATE by which the defendant had been permitted to enforce a costs order against him .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW ( PERSON ) , which has been in force since DATE , provides as follows .

“ ( CARDINAL ) If a court is dilatory in taking any procedural step , such as announcing or holding a hearing , obtaining an expert 's report , or preparing a decision , any party may submit a request to this court for the superior court to impose an appropriate time - limit for the taking of the particular procedural step ; unless sub - section ( CARDINAL ) of this section applies , the court is required to submit the request to the superior court , together with its comments , forthwith .

( CARDINAL ) NORP If the court takes all the procedural steps specified in the request within DATE of receipt , and so informs the party concerned , the request is deemed withdrawn unless the party declares within DATE after service of the notification that it wishes to maintain its request .

( CARDINAL ) The request referred to in sub - section ( CARDINAL ) shall be determined with special expedition by a ORG of the superior court consisting of CARDINAL professional judges , CARDINAL of whom shall preside ; if the court has not been dilatory , the request shall be dismissed . This decision is not subject to appeal . ”
